ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have made it to be a reminder and a comfort for travellers in the wild.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We have made it as a reminder and convenience for the needy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We made it a reminder and a provision for the needy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It is We who have made it as a reminder and a means of comfort for the people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have made it as a reminder of hell and as a utility for travellers in the jungle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: We have made it a Reminder, and an article of use for the Muqwin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: We have made it a reminder and an advantage for the wayfarers of the desert.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We Ourselves made it for a reminder, and a boon to the desert-dwellers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the wilderness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have made it to be a reminder and a benefit for the wayfarers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: We! it is We Who made it a reminder and a provision Unto the campers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It was We who made it a reminder and a boon for the desert-dwellers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: We have made it a Reminder (for the Hell-fire, in the Hereafter); and an article of use for the travellers (and all the others, in this world).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We have made it a reminder, and a blessing to the traveler.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We have made it a reminder, and a comfort for the users.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:73] We made it a reminder, of the fire of Hell, and a boon, a provision, for the desert-travellers (al-muqwīn derives from [the expression] aqwā al-qawmu, ‘they have reached al-qawā or al-qawā’, that is, al-qafr, ‘desolate land’, which is a wilderness (mafāza) that has neither vegetation nor water).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We, even We, appointed it) i.e. the Fire (a memorial) a reminder of the Fire of the Hereafter (and a comfort) a benefit (for the dwellers in the wilderness) for the travellers in the wilderness.
